desking: Desking 360 is an innovative quote manager for online vehicle purchases. From the choice of make and model, to home delivery.
This application is used by car dealerships in the North American market. The customers can access registered vehicles in their 'virtual garage', and validate the transaction online.
The React application is made with Next.js and it is embedded in the CRM (CRM 360 is an Angular.js web application)
widgets: Those widgets have been developed in React.js from scratch, and have been embedded in Desking 360 and CRM 360. The architecture of each application was developed from the boilerplate Razzle (SSR application).
uikit: The ui-kit is a front-end library following the principles of the Atomic Design.
It was developed for internal use in order to standardize the components and the design within the Solutions Médias 360 applications and widgets.
It makes it possible to create a coherent, scalable and maintainable graphic identity.
drawing: The Drawing module is the smart algorithm of Sofdesk web applications.
This module is useful at the heart of estimating roof measurements and virtual installation of solar panels.
It was developed with Paper.js which is the Swiss army knife of vector graphics.
roofgraf: Roofgraf is a web-based application that allows roofing companies to get accurate 3D aerial measurements and create quotes in seconds.
The drawing module (see 'drawing' project) is a front-end tool integrated into the application which allows to obtain precise measurements of roofs, leading to create, build and define a project.
solargraf: Solargraf is a SaaS sales accelerator web application for solar panel installers in the United States and Canada.
Users manage their projects, create and send quotes, growing their customer base and sales.

The drawing module (see 'drawing' project) is a front-end tool integrated into the application which allows to virtually install solar panels in order to estimate and build a project with solar permits.
labam: The original concept of 'La boîte à mots' is to create new words based on a dictionary (chosen lexicon) thanks to an algorithm.
Currently the web application invents new first names (chosen lexicon). It is made with React.js. The backend side (login/logout, liked words) was developed with Firebase.
The app is in continuous improvement. The next features are going to be related to the algorithm, then related to the database and UI/UX aspects.
